It also scored a spot on our Top Ten Games of 2022.
articles.title: Citizen Sleeper 2: Starward Vector Announced

articles.author: Kyle Hilliard
articles.description:
For all its time in development, and gamers being aware of its existence (a trademark for the name was uncovered in 2013), explicit details about Starfield have mostly been light. We’ve known it is a sci-fi game about traveling between planets from the creators of Skyrim for some time, but during Microsoft’s Xbox Games Showcase, Bethesda pulled back the curtain in a big way.
Alongside showing plenty of gameplay covering everything from walking around densely populated cities to exploring unpopulated planets to combat inside and outside of spaceships, Bethesda detailed some of the game’s story and impressive customization options.


Like past Bethesda games, you will find plenty of stories off the main path, but during the 45-minute presentation, we learned about an organization called Cons…
articles.title: Starfield's Direct Showcase Promises A Massive Space Adventure

articles.author: Wesley LeBlanc
articles.description:
Platform:
      PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X/S, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Stadia, PC
      
Publisher:
      CD Projekt
      
Developer:
      CD Projekt Red
      
Release:
                      	December 10, 2020
			(PlayStation 4,
					Xbox One,
					PC,
					Stadia), 	February 15, 2022
			(PlayStation 5,
					Xbox Series X/S)
            
Rating:
      Mature
      
Despite an extremely rocky launch, I enjoyed Cyberpunk 2077 a lot. I beat it around its release in 2020, and I’ve checked in a few times to see how the CD Projekt Red’s post-launch work has improved the game, but those check-ins were always a few hours. I’d drive around, shoot some enemies, and listen to Run The Jewels on the in-game radio. Satisfied with my V’s ending, I didn’t have a reason to return to the meat of the ca…
articles.title: Cyberpunk 2077: Phantom Liberty Preview – It's Good To Be Back

articles.author: Marcus Stewart
articles.description:
Clockwork Revolution made its debut at today’s Xbox Games Showcase via a trailer that set the stage for its steampunk-flavored RPG action.
The first-person adventure puts you in control of a woman hailing from the steam-powered Victorian-era city of Avalon who discovers a time machine, along with the revelation that the city – and its brutal oppression of the lower class – is the result of intricate time manipulation by the villainous Lady Ironwood. To set things right, you’ll travel back to key moments in the past where your actions have a butterfly effect on the Avalon’s future. Hopping between the past and an ever-changing present shows off the game's complex choice-driven storytelling and reactive role-playing, as you'll meet various versions of characters depending on how you tinker with time. 


The game is described as featuring a “deep, narrative-driven world” while the action unfolds in the form of first-person gunplay using steam-powered firearms as well as time-bending technology, such as reversing the time-flow of objects. 
Clockwork Revolution is being developed by inXile Entertainment, makers of the Wasteland and A Bard’s Tale series, and is coming “in due time” to Xbox Series X/S and PC. It will launch on Game Pass.
articles.title: Clockwork Revolution Is A Time-Bending Steampunk RPG From The Makers Of Wasteland

articles.author: Marcus Stewart
articles.description:
For those in the market for an Xbox Series S with more storage, Microsoft has unveiled a 1-terabyte SSD model of the console that launches on September 1.


This carbon black version of the slimmer Xbox boasts roughly double the storage of its original white counterpart. That also means it’s more expensive, retailing for a hundred bucks more at $349.
As a reminder, the Xbox Series S is a digital-only console, meaning it lacks a disc drive. It's also weaker than the $500 Series X, but even this new version remains a decent budget option for those looking to enter the current generation of gaming. 
What do you think of this new version of the Series S? Let us know in the comments.
articles.title: Microsoft Reveals 1TB SSD Xbox Series S

articles.author: Matt Miller
articles.description:
The influence of the Persona games is in full evidence in the first real look at Metaphor: ReFantazio, the new new fantasy RPG on the way from Atlus. From overall visual styling to UI  and fonts, it’s clear that the team at Studio Zero is trying to borrow from that celebrated series.
But make no mistake, this is a brand new game and universe. Fans of the surreal and surprising narrative beats of the Persona series will certainly find a lot to love, even as the new setting may be enough to invite new players into the mix.
Metaphor: ReFantazio is set to release in 2024 for Xbox Series X/S and PC.
articles.title: Persona Makers Announce Metaphor: ReFantazio

articles.author: Wesley LeBlanc
articles.description:
Platform:
      PC
      
Publisher:
      Behaviour Interactive
      
Developer:
      Lunarch Studios
      
During the PC Gaming Show, Behaviour Interactive and Lunarch Studios revealed Islands of Insight today. I watched a 20-minute gameplay demo to learn more about this idyllic open-world puzzle game. While I still have many questions, especially concerning the game’s shared world cooperative multiplayer aspect, Islands of Insight is something I look forward to going hands-on with in the future.
Behaviour Interactive pitches Islands of Insight to me as an “epic open shared world, puzzle adventure game,” and I’m immediately intrigued. I didn’t get to see any of the shared world elements during my demo, but after seeing what players will be doing in the game, I’m even more interested t…
articles.title: Island of Insight Preview – Puzzle Paradise

articles.author: Marcus Stewart
articles.description:
Cities: Skylines II has a release date, and it’s coming on October 24.
A new trailer at today’s Xbox Games Showcase showed off some of the city-building gameplay, which, according to developer Colossal’s previous descriptions, features “a wealth of construction and customization options and advanced modding capabilities.” You can be the judge of that yourself in the video below. 


Cities: Skylines II is coming to PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X/S (including Game Pass), and PC.
articles.title: Cities: Skylines II Launches In October

articles.author: Blake Hester
articles.description:
Today during the most recent Xbox Games Showcase, we got a first look at Still Wakes The Deep, the new game from The Chinese Room, developers of Everybody's Gone To The Rapture and Dear Esther. 
Check out the announcement trailer below:


According to a press release, Still Wakes The Deep puts you in the shoes of an "off-shore oil rig worker, fighting for his life through a vicious storm, perilous surroundings, and the dark, freezing North Sea waters." It's a narrative horror game, a genre The Chinese Room hasn't explored since 2013 with Amnesia: A Machine for Pigs.
articles.title: Still Wakes The Deep Is The Next Game From The Chinese Room

articles.author: Kyle Hilliard
articles.description:
Keanu Reeves appeared in the Xbox Games Showcase to introduce the new trailer for Cyberpunk 2077's new Phantom Liberty expansion, featuring Idris Elba.


The trailer, expectedly, features Reeves'  Johnny Silverhand doing the thing he does in the main game, as well as Elba's character talking about the nature of politics in Cyberpunk's grey world. The trailer also shares lots of new gameplay footage and impressive new vehicles, action, and content.
Phantom Liberty releases on September 26.
articles.title: Keanu Reeves Introduces The Latest Cyberpunk 2077: Phantom Liberty Expansion Trailer

articles.author: Charles Harte
articles.description:
At today's Xbox Showcase, Blizzard announced that Overwatch 2: Invasion, a huge update to Overwatch 2, is coming on August 10. The update will bring the shooter's long-awaited story content, along with co-op events and a new mode, Flashpoint. Check out the full trailer below.


Overwatch 2 was originally created to add this exact new content to the beloved hero shooter, but months went by without any updates on story or PvE game modes. Last month, the developers updated the community with the news that they wouldn't be able to deliver the content initially planned, specifically the Hero mode with dedicated talent trees. Overwatch: Invasion is the first wave of the content that remains.
Overwatch 2 is available on PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X/S, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Switch, and PC.
articles.title: Story Content Comes To Overwatch 2 This August

articles.author: Marcus Stewart
articles.description:
Like A Dragon: Infinite Wealth, the newly-subtitled 8th entry in the series formerly known as Yakuza, got a new trailer that showed off a lot more than we bargained for.
By that, we mean we got a very intimate look at Yakuza: Like A Dragon hero Ichiban Kasuga, who awakens on a beach seemingly with no idea as to how he got there. To make matters worse, he’s completely naked, a fact the shocked beachgoers waste no time bringing to his attention. Your guess is as good as ours as to what trouble the lovable ex-gang enforcer has gotten into this time. 


Like A Dragon: Infinite Wealth is scheduled to launch in early 2024 for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X/S, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, and PC. Its Kiryu-focused prequel, Like a Dragon Gaiden: The Man Who Erased His Name, was recently confirmed to launch on November 9.
articles.title: Ichiban Bares All In First Look At Like A Dragon: Infinite Wealth

articles.author: Matt Miller
articles.description:
Today’s Xbox Showcase gave us a first meaningful look at Avowed, the upcoming fantasy RPG on the way from the team at Obsidian. The game is set in the universe established by the Pillars of Eternity, a world called Eora. However, unlike those prior games, this game is likely to draw more direct comparisons to titles like the Elder Scrolls games, or the gameplay perspective of Obsidian’s other successful franchise, The Outer Worlds.
The new trailer shows an impressive series of first-person encounters in which we see the lead character wielding both medieval weaponry (and firearms!) along with a potent selection of spells to capture and destroy foes. The accompanying voiceover suggests that the story involves the lead character traveling to an area of Eora called the Living Lands – a part of the world established in the Pillars game as a diverse island to the north characterized by strange weather patterns and strange creatures. The player character arrives as an envoy of the emperor of Aedyr, to look into rumors of an unnatural plague.
Avowed is coming to Xbox and PC in 2024. Check out the full trailer below.
articles.title: Obsidian’s Avowed Gameplay Comes Out Swinging

articles.author: Kyle Hilliard
articles.description:
Melina Juergens, who plays Senua in the Hellblade games, appeared during the Xbox Games Showcase to introduce new gameplay footage of the sequel.


The gameplay footage showed Senua exploring a cave of some kind while dealing with her invasive inner voices. If you've played the original game, its oppressive, claustrophobic atmosphere is familiar. Senua entered a pool in the cave while the walls shifted in a kaleidoscopic fashion. The footage was impressive in both visuals and performance.
Unfortunately, no specific release date was offered, but it was given a 2024 release window.
articles.title: Ninja Theory Shares New Senua's Saga: Hellblade II Gameplay Footage

articles.author: Kyle Hilliard
articles.description:
After leaking earlier this week alongside the remake of Persona 3, the Persona 5 tactics game is now official.


The Persona 5 tactics game, called Persona 5 Tactica, releases this year, on November 17. It appears to be a continuation of the stories from Persona 5 and Persona 5 Strikers and adds a new mysterious member to the crew, but with a new chibi art style and grid-based tactics gameplay. Persona 5 Tactica will also be available on Xbox Game Pass.
articles.title: Persona 5 Tactica Officially Announced

articles.author: Blake Hester
articles.description:
At long last, Payday 3 has a release date. Today during the Xbox Games Showcase, it was announced that the multiplayer bank-robber simulator will be coming out on September 21. 
Aside from a date, a flashy new trailer showed plenty of the robbery and action mechanics off. As you might've guessed, it sure does look like another Payday. Check it out below:


Payday 3 was announced all the way back in 2016 and has been stuck in development hell ever since. Apparently, it's set in a "living, enormous representation" of New York City."
articles.title: Payday 3 Is Coming Out In September

articles.author: Kyle Hilliard
articles.description:
After an accidental early posting earlier this week on Atlus' official Instagram accounts, the remake of Persona 3 is officially real.


The Persona 3 remake is called Persona 3 Reload and is being made in Unreal Engine. The footage of the game points to it being a total, from-the-ground-up remake, which might explain why the recent re-release of Persona 3 on modern platforms was somewhat underwhelming. The game is set to release in early 2024 and will be available on Xbox Game Pass.
articles.title: Persona 3 Remake Officially Announced

articles.author: Marcus Stewart
articles.description:
Compulsion Games, makers of We Happy Few and Contrast, has announced a fascinating new project called South of Midnight.
The stylish trailer begins with a strange musician strumming his guitar surrounded by forest critters in a bayou-like swamp. A young woman pays a visit to inquire about a dangerous monster, which attempts to ambush her until she retaliates by weaving a seemingly magical web to subdue it. There's no gameplay, and the trailer's description describes South of Midnight as a "fantastical and macabre third-person action-adventure set in the American Deep South."


South of Midnight has no release window, but it’s coming to PC and Xbox Series X/S and will launch on Game Pass.
articles.title: Compulsion Games Reveals South Of Midnight

articles.author: Charles Harte
articles.description:
Today during the Xbox Showcase, we finally got a look at the open-world Star Wars game Ubisoft has been working on for the last few years. The game is being developed by Massive Entertainment, a Ubisoft studio known for making The Division and The Division 2. The cinematic reveal trailer didn't show any gameplay, instead relying on cgi cutscenes to set the mood of the world, showing a young woman on the run from a bounty hunter. You can watch it for yourself below.


The description of the trailer on YouTube offers some more concrete details about the game.
"Experience the first-ever open world Star Wars game, set between the events of The Empire Strikes Back and Return of the Jedi," the description says. "Explore distinct planets across the galaxy, both iconic and new. Risk it all as Kay Vess, an emerging scoundrel seeking freedom and the means to start a new life, along with her companion Nix. Fight, steal, and outwit your way through the galaxy’s crime syndicates as you join the galaxy’s most wanted."
While the new title isn't out until 2024, we'll be learning more about it at Ubisoft's showcase tomorrow. For the full lineup of showcases this month, check out our streaming schedule.
articles.title: Ubisoft's Open-World Star Wars Game Is Out Next Year

articles.author: Kyle Hilliard
articles.description:
The new Fable from Playground Games was previously announced, but the latest trailer gives us a better sense of the game's comedic tone. The trailer (but not the full game, presumably) stars Richard Ayoade of The IT Crowd fame as Dave commiserating about the age of heroes being over and the age of agriculture being the future. In a twist, however, it is revealed that Ayoade's character is a giant fending off heroes who are trying to invade his home.


From there an action sequence begins with a hero outrunning the giant Ayoade. It is revealed in the end that the hero has defeated the giant by show of them sitting on his shattered glasses. The trailer's description on YouTube shares that this new entry will continue to take place in Albion.
No release date was revealed, but the game will be available on Game Pass day one.
articles.title: Richard Ayoade Stars In New Fable Trailer

articles.author: Wesley LeBlanc
articles.description:
Platform:
      Xbox Series X/S, Xbox One, Switch, PC
      
Publisher:
      Annapurna Interactive
      
Developer:
      Geometric Interactive
      
Release:
                      	2023			
            
Since Cocoon’s reveal last year, I’ve been excited to one day check it out. Coming from Jeppe Carlsen, a former lead designer behind Playdead’s Limbo and Inside, its reveal trailer in 2022 made splashes amongst fans of the games Carlsen worked on. During Summer Games Fest this year, I finally got to play roughly 30 minutes of this strange, sci-fi puzzle game, and I don’t think it could have made a better first hands-on impression. 
Immediately, Cocoon’s visual style is striking. Its minimalist sci-fi aesthetic feels right at home within the lineage of Playdead games, although it’s import…
articles.title: Cocoon Preview – An Excellent First Impression

articles.author: Marcus Stewart
articles.description:
If you enjoy classic 3D platformers and games that let you creatively tinker with their worlds, you may want to put Ruffy and the Riverside on your radar. This open-world adventure gives players the power to remove textures from the environment itself to slap on other objects, opening the door for some inventive puzzle-solving.
As Ruffy, you’re the chosen one with the power of Swap. That means you can mix and match elements of the world as you see fit. Need to climb up a mountain? Rip that patch of vines off a wall and slap it over a waterfall to create an instant climbing path. Change the time of day by switching out the sun and moon. Turn a heavy stone into a floating platform by replacing it with a wood texture. Copy and paste are your best friends and seemingly allow for a number of creative solutions to Riverside's many challenges. 


In addition to a primary story campaign, you’ll tackle sidequests given by the colorful residents. Speaking of color, the world sports a great-looking papercraft art direction. Thankfully, we shouldn’t have to wait terribly long to explore Ruffy and the Riverside since it launches later this year for Switch and PC (with other consoles to be announced later).
articles.title: Ruffy And The Riverside Lets You Change The World By Rearranging Textures

articles.author: Marcus Stewart
articles.description:
The Future Games Show closed out with a new trailer for The Spirit of the Samurai, an eye-catching stop-motion 2D Metroidvania-style action game coming next year.


The game’s striking stop-motion presentation immediately stands out, paying homage to the classic model animation of Ray Harryhausen films, such as Mighty Joe Young, Jason and the Argonauts, and Clash of the Titans. Players guide three very different characters – a samurai, a Kodama spirit, and a cat – on a journey to save Japan from invading Oni. As the samurai Takeshi and the much smaller Kodoma, you’ll hack apart undead soldiers and supernatural foes from Japanese mythology. As the cat, platforming and stealth are the names of the game, as you’ll avoid enemies such as one, particularly toothy and terrifying-looking demon. 
The Spirit of the Samurai has been in the works for a few years by developer Digital Mind Games and arrives in 2024 for PC.
articles.title: The Spirit Of The Samurai Is A 2D Metroidvania Inspired By Classic Stop-Motion Animation

articles.author: Brian Shea
articles.description:
This week on All Things Nintendo, we're recording from Los Angeles, California, shortly after the events of Summer Game Fest 2023. We begin the show by chatting about Summer Game Fest news and hands-on previews before transitioning to a couple of interviews with some developers of some of the biggest games at the show.
If you'd like to follow Brian on social media, you can do so on his Instagram @BrianPShea. You follow Jill Grodt on Twitter: @Finruin
You can also find Jill's work at The Indie Informer.
The All Things Nintendo podcast is a weekly show where we can celebrate, discuss, and break down all the latest games, news, and announcements from the industry's most recognizable name. Each week, Brian is joined by different guests to talk about what's happening in the world of Nintendo. Along the way, they'll share personal stories, uncover hidden gems in the eShop, and even look back on the classics we all grew up with. A new episode hits every Friday!
Be sure to subscribe to All Things Nintendo on your favorite podcast platform. The show is available on Apple Podcasts, Spotify, Google Podcasts, and YouTube.
00:00:00 – Introduction



If you'd like to get in touch with the All Things Nintendo podcast, you can email AllThingsNintendo@GameInformer.com, messaging Brian on Instagram (@BrianPShea), or by joining the official Game Informer Discord server. You can do that by linking your Discord account to your Twitch account and subscribing to the Game Informer Twitch channel. From there, find the All Things Nintendo channel under "Community Spaces."
For Game Informer's other podcast, be sure to check out The Game Informer Show with host Alex Van Aken, which covers the weekly happenings of the video game industry!
articles.title: Ed Boon, Takashi Iizuka, Summer Game Fest 2023 | All Things Nintendo

articles.author: Marcus Stewart
articles.description:
In this episode of The Game Informer Show, hosts Marcus Stewart and Kyle Hilliard are joined by special guest Scott White to discuss our thoughts and experiences with Diablo IV! After that, we'll be running down all of the major announcements from Summer Game Fest and sharing our thoughts on the event as a whole. 


Follow us on social media: Marcus Stewart (@MarcusStewart7), Kyle Hilliard (@KyleMHilliard), Scott White (@ProfessorRPG)
The Game Informer Show is a weekly gaming podcast covering the latest video game news, industry topics, exclusive reveals, and reviews. Join host Alex Van Aken every Thursday for a chat about your favorite games – past and present – with Game Informer staff, developers, and special guests from around the industry. Listen on Apple Podcasts, Spotify, or your favorite podcast app.
Matt Storm, the freelance audio editor for The Game Informer Show, edited this episode. Matt is an experienced podcast host and producer who's been speaking into a microphone for over a decade. You should listen to Matt's shows like the "Fun" And Games Podcast and Reignite, a BioWare-focused podcast. 

Jump to the timestamps to get to a particular point of discussion:
00:00:00 - Intro
00:02:55 - Scott White Introduction
00:05:01 - Diablo IV
00:40:53 - Summer Game Fest
01:44:43 - Housekeeping
articles.title: Diablo IV Review And Summer Game Fest Reactions | GI Show

articles.author: Game Informer Editorial
articles.description:
You've probably already seen all the news out of Summer Game Fest 2023, but as with E3 in the past, this show allows members of the media and other content creators to meet with the developers of many of the hottest games on the horizon. At Summer Game Fest Play Days, we spent hours trying out all the most anticipated games, all while discovering several hidden gems among the leviathans. 
While the Play Days aren't nearly on the scale of something like E3, which would typically happen during this time of year annually, the Game Informer crew has seen plenty of amazing games over the course of our time there. Check out our favorite titles we've seen, played, and talked about below, and be sure to check back throughout the weekend as we see more games!
  



      
												
Sonic Superst…
articles.title: The Coolest Games We're Playing At Summer Game Fest 2023

articles.author: Brian Shea
articles.description:
Platform:
      PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X/S, Switch, PC
      
Publisher:
      Warner Bros. Games
      
Developer:
      NetherRealm Studios
      
Release:
                      	September 19, 2023
			
            
Mortal Kombat 1 represents a clean slate for the long-running fighting game franchise just as the story does for its characters. After the cataclysmic events of Mortal Kombat 11 and its story expansion, Liu Kang has assumed the role of the all-powerful fire god. While he created the world with visions of peace, the Mortal Kombat characters do what they do best in relatively short order, and the blood starts splattering once again. 
While I don't get a ton of additional insight into the story, I get to play several fights in the upcoming reboot. In my build, I have four cha…
articles.title: Mortal Kombat 1 Preview - Pulling No Punches

articles.author: Brian Shea
articles.description:
Platform:
      PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X/S, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Switch, PC
      
Publisher:
      Sega
      
Developer:
      Sonic Team
      
Release:
                      	2023			
            
Last year’s Sonic Frontiers brought Sega’s mascot some much-needed success in the 3D gaming realm, but outside of some segments in the 3D adventures and the externally developed Sonic Mania, the 2D side of the Sonic franchise has been grossly underserviced in recent years. Announced yesterday, Sonic Superstars hopes to give that corner of the Sonic gaming universe a shot in the arm, delivering gorgeous HD visuals, four-player cooperative play, and a bevy of unique Emerald Powers.
However, the announcement was met with a dose of skepticism, as, for many, it immediately conjured memories…
articles.title: Sonic Superstars Preview - Speeding Around The New 2D Adventure

articles.author: Marcus Stewart
articles.description:
After years wallowing in purgatory, 2011's Shadow of the Damned is getting another shot in the limelight via a remaster. On top of that, developer Grasshopper Manufacture is holding its own E3-style presentation next week.
Shadows of the Damned was the product of a collaboration between Grasshopper's Goichi Suda (AKA Suda51), who wrote the game, and Resident Evil creator Shinji Mikami, who served as a producer. It's a third-person shooter about demon hunter Garcia Hotspur, who must rescue his girlfriend after she's abducted by the forces of the underworld with the help of his trusty phallic-joke loving demon, Johnson. The game's bombastic, supernatural action and absurd sense of humor made it generally well-liked upon release (We scored it a 9.25 out of 10 in our review), but it has never been ported beyond its original platforms on PlayStation 3 and Xbox 360. That's about to change.


The humorous trailer doesn't reveal any details about the remaster, but we'll likely learn more at the inaugural Grasshopper Direct on June 14. The event celebrates the studios 25th anniversary and kicks off at 9 p.m. PT/12 a.m. ET, so fans in the U.S. will have to brew an extra cup of coffee if they want to catch the event live. 
Are you a fan of Shadows of the Damned or does this remaster entice you to give it a shot? Let us know in the comments!
articles.title: Shadows Of The Damned Is Getting Remastered

articles.author: Wesley LeBlanc
articles.description:
Platform:
      PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, Switch, PC, Mac, iOS
      
Publisher:
      MWM Interactive
      
Developer:
      Night School Studio
      
Release:
                      	July 12, 2023
			
            
Rating:
      Teen
      
Oxenfree II: Lost Signals feels like returning to a familiar place in a great way. I’ve known about the sequel for a couple of years – since Night School Studio announced it in 2021 – but it wasn’t until I went hands-on with it during Summer Games Fest that it dawned on me just how long it’s been since Oxenfree first came out. 
In that seven-year gap, I immediately notice that Oxenfree II is even more beautiful than its predecessor, an already pretty game thanks to its unique visual style. That aesthetic returns, but it pops even more on screen. N…
articles.title: Oxenfree II: Lost Signals Preview - Just A Taste

articles.author: Marcus Stewart
articles.description:
Super Replay returns, and we're checking out Banjo-Kazooie: Nuts & Bolts! Join us today Friday on Twitch at 2:00 p.m. Central as we kick of the adventure, which will continue each week until we roll credits. We'll also have every episode available the next day on our Game Informer Shows YouTube Channel (or you can watch the videos in the above playlist). 
Banjo-Kazooie: Nuts & Bolts was released for the Xbox 360 on November 11, 2008. The third (and, so far, final) entry in Rare's beloved platforming series centers on vehicle creation, where players collect and slap together hundreds of parts to assemble their own wacky contraptions to explore. The bevy of possible combinations and emphasis on player choice and creativity was largely unprecedented at the time, paving the way for future games such as the upcoming The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom. However, this direction would divide fans due to how much it strays from the traditional Banjo formula. So where will I land on it? Let's find out.
Join me, Marcus Stewart, alongside Kyle Hilliard as we explore one of the Xbox 360's biggest hidden gems to see whether it holds up or falls apart like a poorly constructed doohickey. 
Watch on Twitch!
If you enjoy our livestreams but haven’t subscribed to our Twitch channel, know that doing so not only gives you notifications and access to special emotes. You’ll also be granted entry to the official Game Informer Discord channel, where our welcoming community members, moderators, and staff gather to talk games, entertainment, food, and organize hangouts! Be sure to also follow our second YouTube channel, Game Informer Shows, for to watch other Replay episodes as well as Twitch archives such as Replay, GI Live, and more.
articles.title: Super Replay | Banjo-Kazooie: Nuts & Bolts Part 6

articles.author: Marcus Stewart
articles.description:
Friday the 13th: The Game is being delisted from storefronts at the end of the year due to an expiring license. 
A statement from the game's official Twitter account explains that the asymmetric multiplayer slasher title will be removed from retail and digital storefronts once the license expires on December 31st. However, the game will still be playable for those who own it through at least the following year, meaning up to December 31, 2024. Until then, the base price of the game will be dropped to $4.99, and each piece of DLC will cost $0.99. 
pic.twitter.com/n52hJPUxwx
June 8, 2023

Friday the 13th: The Game pits a team of players controlling Camp Crystal Lake counselors working together to survive against a player-controlled Jason Voorhees. The game didn’t arrive to the warmest reception when it launched in 2017, but it’s always a bummer to see games disappear, especially when it's at the mercy of IP licensing. Even before this final blow, the game had a rocky existence due to legal disputes with the film's original creators halting the distribution of DLC and, later, the eventual shutdown of its dedicated servers. 
What did you think of Friday the 13th: The Game? Will you be picking it up before it leaves storefronts? Let us know in the comments!
articles.title: Friday the 13th: The Game Will Be Delisted At The End Of The Year

articles.author: Marcus Stewart
articles.description:
Bandai Namco is inviting players to throwdown in Tekken 8 for the first time with a pair of closed network tests next month.


The tests lets players duke it out with 16 fighters across five stages. You’ll have to register at the official website before June 27 to participate, and the tests take place over two weekends, with PlayStation 5 players getting first dibs.
Week 1 - July 21 -24 (PlayStation 5)
Week 2 - July 28-31 (PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X/S, PC)
Tekken 8 still doesn’t have a launch date, but you can check out our impressions from our last hands-on look at the game here.
articles.title: You Can Play Tekken 8 In A Closed Network Test Next Month

articles.author: Kyle Hilliard
articles.description:
Double Fine's annual Day of the Devs events and live streams have become an impressive source of unique indie titles. This year's Summer Games Fest-adjacent live stream was no exception with updates on titles we're already excited about (like Hyper Light Breaker), new game announcements from developers with impressive resumes (like Beastieball), and completely new experiences that we can't wait to get our hands on (like Helskate). You can see everything that was announced and shown below.

Beastieball
Beastieball has a simple premise: what if, instead of battling, Pokémon just wanted to play volleyball? In this turn-based RPG, explore an open world, befriend monsters called Beasties, and recruit them to your Beastieball team. Beasties have relationships with each other as well, gaining acc…
articles.title: Chicory Dev Announces Pokémon-Inspired Volleyball And More From Day Of The Devs

articles.author: Marcus Stewart
articles.description:
Summer Game Fest concluded with the first big look at Final Fantasy VII Rebirth, the next chapter of Final Fantasy VII Remake. A lenghty trailer gave us some good looks at its gameplay, story, as well as a much-anticipated release window. 
The story sees Cloud and the gang explore beyond Midgar to stop Sephiroth’s plans, and we see looks at the grander Final Fantasy VII story, likely to be laden with new twists. In terms of new faces, get to see Elena join Reno and Rude in the Turks, and Yuffie, the fiery Wutai ninja introduced in the Intermission story expansion, officially joins the party. 


Perhaps the most surprising revelation is that Rebirth will come on two discs. Given how much storage a single Blu-ray can hold, that suggests that Rebirth could be a mammoth-sized experience, which is wild given that it’s only Part 2 of a planned trilogy of games. We also now know that Rebirth is coming in early 2024 exclusively to PlayStation 5.
articles.title: Final Fantasy VII Rebirth Is On Two Discs And Launches Early Next Year

articles.author: Charles Harte
articles.description:
Since Fortnite's newest season, Wilds is coming out tomorrow, it was only fitting that we get our first look at it on the Summer Game Fest stage. Featuring rideable raptors, skating on vines, and Optimus Prime, it looks, well, wild. Check out the new trailer below.


Epic has been teasing the new battle pass skins all week. In addition to Optimus Prime, we see people wielding some glowing blue weapons, a Nathan Drake-type, and a new version of Meowscles wearing a Tiger-striped shirt. You can check out all the new skins below.

Wilds is expected to have new weapons, augments, and an updated map. Downtime for the new season will begin on June 9th at 2 AM Eastern, with the updated servers coming back online later that morning.
articles.title: Optimus Prime Rolls Into Fortnite's Latest Season

articles.author: Blake Hester
articles.description:
Today during Summer Games Fest, we got our first extended look at gameplay for Like A Dragon Gaiden: The Man Who Erased His Name.
As previously revealed, Gaiden takes place between the events of Yakuza 6: The Song of Life and Yakuza: Like a Dragon, filling in the gaps of what longtime series protagonist Kiryu Kazuma was up to after faking his own death in the former before reappearing in the latter. 
From the looks of it, Kiryu, now being called "Codename Joryu," has been running jobs for a mysterious someone. As you might expect, this mainly means he's beating the holy hell out of dudes in the street. The trailer shows a variety of large-scale fights, as well as Kiryu's new fighting abilities, which include a rope-type weapon he can use to bring items and people closer to him.
Check out the trailer below:


As pointed out by Gematsu, Gaiden gameplay details actually leaked yesterday on the PlayStation Store. Here are some of the key details:
"Dynamically switch between the Yakuza and Agent fighting styles in visceral melee combat.
"With the Yakuza style, strike fear into enemies by unleashing wildly aggressive moves powered by Kiryu’s unparalleled strength and flair.
"Or up the ante with the Agent style by delivering blows with absolute speed and precision, while using an array of high-tech gadgets like electrified bind wires to stun enemies then send them flying.
"Strategically adapt to the situation and leverage both styles to dominate and destroy hordes of enemies."
"Whether you’re brawling in the secret Castle arena, singing a new karaoke song, enjoying a drink at the live-action cabaret club, or racing in the pocket circuit, the world offers a variety of immersive experiences.
"An intriguing informant named Akame also provides thrilling sub-missions, drawing you into an epic showdown that unfolds the more you explore and enjoy Sotenbori, Yokohama and the mysterious Castle."
Like A Dragon Gaiden: The Man Who Erased His Name will be released on November 9, 2023.
articles.title: Here's Your First Look At Like A Dragon Gaiden: The Man Who Erased His Name

articles.author: Charles Harte
articles.description:
Sick of losing cubes in Marvel Snap? This newest game mode might be the solution to your problems. Today during Summer Game Fest, Second Dinner's Chief Development Officer Ben Brode took to the stage to announce that Conquest, Marvel Snap's newest mode, will launch on June 13. The news was accompanied by a promotional skit featuring SungWon Cho, who you might recognize as Ratatoskr from God of War: Ragnarök. You can watch the trailer below.


Conquest Mode works similarly to Marvel Snap's Battle Mode. Two players are matched up for a series of games, each with ten units of health. Instead of wagering cubes, the currency players use to gain levels in the standard ranked mode, Conquest will have players wagering health. Unlike Battle Mode, which ends as soon as one player runs out of health, Conquest has players progress through tiers of competition, requiring longer winning streaks the higher they get. As a reward for making it to the top, players will receive exclusive cosmetics.
“It’s just insane how good players have gotten at Marvel Snap since we launched in the fall," Brode said in a press release. "For our most competitive, high-skilled players, we wanted to give them the ultimate challenge with Conquest. Players can now find out who truly is the best of the best and worthy of ultimate Marvel Snap glory!! What’s also super cool about Conquest is that the Proving Grounds can double as a great way to try out new decks, as Conquest has no impact on a player's Marvel Snap season rank."
Marvel Snap recently started its "Spider-Versus" season, which will introduce new cards such as Ghost-Spider, Spider-Ham, and Silk. The game is currently available on PC and Mobile devices and made it onto the list of our top ten games of 2022.
articles.title: Marvel Snap Gets A Conquest Mode This Month

articles.author: Marcus Stewart
articles.description:
Phoenix Labs, the studio behind Dauntless, unveiled a much different project in the form of Fae Farm last year. As the name suggests, it's a cozy farming simulator that adds spellcasting to the mix, and a new trailer premiering during Summer Game Fest revealed it is launching on September 8.
Fae Farm takes place in the magical realm of Azoria, which requires your green thumb to help restore it to its former glory. That means tilling the land to grow crops, gathering resources by exploring, and decorating your homesteads both inside and out. You can farm alone or enlist help by inviting friends in online multiplayer (as well as locally on Switch). Check out some of the activities the game offers in the gameplay trailer video below.


Fae Farm will be available on Switch and PC via Steam and The Epic Game Store.
articles.title: Dauntless Developer's Fae Farm Launches In September

articles.author: Charles Harte
articles.description:
Brian Intihar, Creative Director at Insomniac Games, took to the Summer Game Fest stage today to reveal some new details about Marvel's Spider-Man 2. While we didn't get any new gameplay footage, we got two new pieces of concept art featuring the game's main villains, Kraven and Venom.
Venom was revealed in the original trailer for Spider-Man 2, but we didn't see anything more than his face at the very end. This art is our first look at Insomniac's take on the character. When asked about his identity, Intihar would only say that it was not Eddie Brock, leaving the man inside the symbiote a mystery. But if you've played 2018's Spider-Man, you've probably got a good guess as to who's inside. For the full interview, check out the video below.


Additionally, we got an official release date. You can check out a map twice as big as the last with twice the web-slingers when Marvel's Spider-Man 2 launches on PS5 on October 20, 2023.
articles.title: Marvel's Spider-Man 2 Comes Out This October

articles.author: Marcus Stewart
articles.description:
Larian Studios clearly wanted another easily detestable bad guy for Baldur’s Gate 3, so it turned to Harry Potter’s Lucius Malfoy to play one of the game's newly revealed antagonists. 
That would be actor Jason Isaacs, who portrayed the father of Harry Potter rival Draco Malfoy in the films. Isaacs will take the role of Lord Enver Gortash, designer of the Steel Watchers, magical warriors tasked with protecting Baldur’s Gate after Duke Ravengard vanishes. Players will bump heads with this powerful enforcer as they find themselves in the middle of a power struggle engulfing the city. You can see his introduction in the trailer below. 


"It was a thrill to join the Baldur’s Gate universe but I fear that the magnificent Lord Enver Gortash is being mischaracterized as a villain," says Isaacs in a press release. "In a brutal world of betrayals and butchery, he’s learned to lie better and backstab first. The joy in voicing him - apart from the obvious pleasure in getting to look so glorious - was that the creative team and I got to play loose enough to find ways that he could enjoy the ride and make the players hate him more!"
Isaac isn’t the only famous name players will encounter. J.K. Simmons (Portal 2's Cave Johnson, Spider-Man's J. Jonah Jameson) was previously revealed as General Ketheric Thorm. 
Baldur’s Gate 3 launches on August 31 for PlayStation 5 and PC.
articles.title: Baldur's Gate 3 Gets Lucius Malfoy Actor As A Bad Guy

articles.author: Marcus Stewart
articles.description:
Palworld has always seemed too good to be true, given its vibrant world and amazingly absurd premise of inserting guns and survival features into a Pokémon-inspired open-world game. After a long wait, fans will finally get to try it for themselves early next year.
Developer Pocketpair revealed during Summer Game Fest that Palworld is launching in Steam Early Access in January. A long wait to be sure (especially since the game was last slated to enter Early Access this year), but we'll take any proof that this game is a real thing because it continues to look bonkers. 


Palworld takes place in a world where players can catch and befriend cute, legally-distinct monsters called Pals. The game features an open world that supports multiplayer (up to 8 players) where you can have Pals give a helping hand in battles or in exploration, put them to work making resources in your factories, sell them off, or just eat them. Combat unfolds as a third-person shooter with players wielding assault weapons and other guns to blast enemy Pals and other threats, or you can use Pal’s unique abilities to get the job done. In multiplayer, you can explore together, trade Pals, or steal each other's monsters and items in battle. 
What do you think of this latest look at Palworld? Let us know in the comments!
articles.title: Palworld Catches A January Early Access Launch Date

articles.author: Marcus Stewart
articles.description:
Alan Wake 2 got its first unedited gameplay showing during Summer Game Fest, with Remedy head Sam Lake divulging more details on the upcoming survival horror title.
Sam Lake offered further details on previously revealed factoids about Alan Wake 2. The game lets you play as Alan and newcomer FBI agent Saga, who each sport separate but connected campaigns. Players can switch between the two at any time, with Saga exploring the pacific northwest while Alan tries to escape the Dark Place. Since players can change characters freely, this opens up a plethora of storytelling differences; you can even play the full game as one character if you choose. 
The sequel’s shift to pure survival horror is shown off with the game’s heavy Resident Evil vibes as Saga riddles a terrifying killer with bullets while dodging his attacks. The trailer ends with some investigative gameplay, but we don’t get a long look at this part of the experience.


Alan Wake 2 launches on October 17 for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X/S, and PC via The Epic Game Store.
articles.title: Alan Wake 2 Gets Unedited Gameplay And New Story Details

articles.author: Kyle Hilliard
articles.description:
Set to the tune of "You Give Love a Bad Name" by Bon Jovi, John Carpenter's Toxic Commando is a game about fighting zombies in, presumably, the apocalypse. The trailer showed a group of four characters in a car together shooting at zombies in the first-person perspective. The trailer also leaned heavily on vehicle gameplay. The characters are shown in the car together, driving through zombies, and even pulling other vehicles out of the mud.
Little else is known about the game, but it will be available in 2024.
articles.title: John Carpenter's Toxic Commando Is A Zombie Vehicle First-Person Shooter

articles.author: Matt Miller
articles.description:
Today’s Summer Game Fest gave us a first look at Sand Land, the new game from Bandai Namco, based on a manga by celebrated artist, Akira Toriyama.
The new game boasts a gorgeous art style that is unmistakably rooted in Toriyama’s style, and seems to mix action, vehicles, and fighting game mechanics together to tell a story set in a mysterious desert world.
It’s unknown at this point if the game will follow the same thread as the original manga. If it does, the story will follow a former general named Sheriff Rao as he tries to overcome a corrupt king with the help of the demon prince Beelzebub and his friend Thief. The three work together (including stealing a tank) to bring water back to a parched world.
There’s still much to learn about the video game adaptation, but the announcement trailer looked beautiful. Sand Land is headed to PS5, Xbox Series X/S, and PC, but no word yet on release date.
articles.title: Akira Toriyama’s Sand Land Game Announced

articles.author: Brian Shea
articles.description:
Sega and Sonic Team have announced Sonic Superstars, a new 2D adventure starring the company's Blue Blur. Though Sonic is the star, as the name implies, there are plenty of supporting cast members. In this reveal trailer, we also see Tails, Knuckles, and Amy appear as playable characters, each with their own unique abilities.
For the first time since Sonic Adventure, original Sonic the Hedgehog designer and artist Naoto Ohshima returns to the franchise. As the original designer of the Sonic the Hedgehog and Dr. Eggman characters, he will bring an all-new character to the franchise through Sonic Superstars. 
Sonic Superstars also introduces seven different Emerald Powers. In the trailer, we see Sonic create clones of himself and climb waterfalls, but the press release also teases "powering up." 
Taking place on the North Star Islands, Sonic Superstars purports to deliver never-before-seen environments, hinting that, despite the compilation-style name, we will be speeding through all new levels instead of the usual suspects like Green Hill and Chemical Plant. The press release teases enormous creatures and evil plans from Dr. Eggman, while Fang the Sniper (AKA Nack the Weasel) from Sonic Triple Trouble, Sonic the Fighters, and other games seems to appear as a secondary enemy.
In the trailer, we also see what look to be Special Stages that borrow from the rotating Special Stages from Sonic 1, plus a 3D Special Stage. The modernized HD graphics look great in motion, but the proof will be in how it plays, particularly following how disappointed many in the community were by Sonic the Hedgehog 4. If Sonic Team is able to nail the physics, momentum, and overall feel, Sonic Superstars could do for the 2D Sonic series what New Super Mario Bros. did for the 2D Mario series.
Sonic Superstars releases both digitally and physically for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X/S, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Switch, and PC this fall, and will start at $60.
articles.title: Sonic Superstars Is A Modernized 2D Adventure With Four-Player Co-Op

articles.author: Kyle Hilliard
articles.description:
Lies of P, a game that is somehow inspired by Bloodborne and the 1883 Italian novel, The Adventures of Pinocchio, is getting a playable demo and it will be available today on all platforms the game is releasing for.


Along with the news of the demo, the game also received a new trailer, a collection of new screenshots (seen below), and the reveal of a collector's edition for the game. The deluxe version of the game will include the Great Venigni’s Set, a unique mask, and three days early access to the game. The physical collector's edition will include a steelbook, artbook, and a digital soundtrack.
The demo, which will be available today, let's players check out the game's first two chapters, which will let players tackle a boss alongside introducing a number of characters.

Lies of P releases  September 19 on PlayStation 5 and 4, Xbox Series X/S and Xbox One, and PC.
articles.title: Lies Of P Is Releasing In September And Getting A Free Demo Today

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
Pirate IPTV subscribers in the UK face a continual threat of their streams going down during a crucial Premier League game or a big boxing event. VPNs can mitigate these outages but behind the scenes IPTV providers also work hard to prevent streams being blocked. Until now, these efforts have never been discussed in public but today we can reveal how Flawless IPTV was able to undermine the Premier League's blocking program and remain online.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: How Premier League’s IPTV Piracy Blocking Was Undermined

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
Most people use search engines to answer any questions they may have. Interestingly, Microsoft's Bing reverses this role too, questioning users on all sorts of topics; what their favorite torrent client is, what type of movies they stream on the pirate site Fmovies, or how they manage to keep themselves safe while using The Pirate Bay. 
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Bing Asks Users How They Protect Themselves On The Pirate Bay

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
Internet provider RCN and several major music companies are exploring options to settle their piracy liability dispute. A mediator was assigned this week to help the parties reach a deal but the same can't be said about a lawsuit filed against the ISP by a group of filmmakers. That battle only appears to have intensified, with a new law firm and evidence provider joining the case.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Record Labels and RCN Open to Settling Piracy Liability Lawsuit

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
The developers of Invidious, a privacy-respecting alternative front-end for YouTube, have received a cease-and-desist notice from YouTube's legal department. The free and open source software, which provides a YouTube experience minus advertising and user tracking, has been instructed to shut down within seven days. As things stand, cooperation isn't on the agenda.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: YouTube Orders ‘Invidious’ Privacy Software to Shut Down in 7 Days

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
Last month five men behind pirate IPTV service 'Flawless' were sentenced to more than 30 years in prison. While the service generated millions in revenue, operations like this also cost a lot to run. So how much does it cost to buy pirate streams wholesale? Rent server infrastructure? Pay almost two dozen members of staff? Documents seen by TorrentFreak provide the answers.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Pirate IPTV: Running Costs of UK’s Largest Service Revealed

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
Reddit allows people to freely share and discuss content but that freedom has its downsides too. In Denmark, several actors feel abused and violated by Reddit users who clip and share their nude scenes completely out of context. There is a copyright angle to this as well, as the Rights Alliance urges Reddit to provide tools to screen uploads for potential infringements.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: ‘Nude Scenes’ Controversy Triggers Call on Reddit to Filter Infringing Uploads

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
Maria Schneider's lawsuit against YouTube began with great ambitions to vastly improve the copyright enforcement landscape on YouTube to the benefit of artists everywhere. With a jury trial just days away, but with class-action status already denied, what's left of the lawsuit could still deliver a win for the plaintiffs. Fulfilling ambitions will probably have to wait until another time.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: What Remains of Content ID Lawsuit Seems Unlikely to Change YouTube

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
Manga publishers Kodakawa, Shogakukan, and Shueisha hope to recoup millions of dollars in damages from the operator of Mangamura, which was once the largest manga piracy site. To assist in their legal battle in Japan, the publishers went to a U.S. federal court this week, requesting traffic stats and personal data from the site's accounts at Google and Cloudflare. 
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Manga Publishers Seek Google Analytics Data to Back $14m Piracy Damages Claim

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
While the shutdown of RARBG is bad news for former users, scammers are happily exploiting the confusion to boost their own traffic. One copycat in particular, which has been around for years, has sneakily managed to convince some people that the site hasn't been shut down. RARGB is working just fine! Oh, wait...
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Dodgy RARBG Knockoffs Thrive as Former Users Seek Refuge

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
After somehow managing to survive years of losses that pushed the company ever closer to bankruptcy, Rightscorp's piracy settlement model suddenly underpinned recording industry lawsuits against ISPs in the United States. After joining the  American Association of Independent Music (A2IM), Rightscorp hopes that the Indie sector will reinvigorate its fortunes.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Rightscorp Taps Indie Labels to Fuel New Wave of Piracy Settlement Action

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
Canada's 'Notice and Notice' regime requires ISPs to forward infringement notices to subscribers, typically those linked to the sharing of movies via BitTorrent. U.S. movie companies say that since Bell Canada failed to forward around 40,000 notices, they are now entitled to CAD$400m in damages. Bell's response included allegations of copyright misuse, abuse of process, champerty and maintenance and unlawful means conspiracy. That hasn't gone according to plan.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Setback for Bell Canada in $400m Movie Piracy Lawsuit

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
Japan's largest manga piracy site 13DL is no more. The site closed its doors shortly after a DMCA subpoena required CDN provider Cloudflare to uncover the identity of the site's operator.  Anti-piracy group CODA says that Cloudflare has yet to hand over the information but, together with publishers and 'ethical hackers', the group will do everything in its power to hold the site owner responsible.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Japan’s Largest Manga Piracy Site Shuts Down Following Cloudflare Probe

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
Every week we take a close look at the most pirated movies on torrent sites. What are pirates downloading? 'John Wick: Chapter 4' tops the chart, followed by 'Hypnotic'. ‘The Super Mario Bros. Movie' completes the top three.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Top 10 Most Pirated Movies of The Week – 06/05/2023

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
Through several lawsuits, Danish publishers tried to send a clear message: educating oneself through pirated textbooks is illegal. This message has thus far failed to make an impact. New research published by the Rights Alliance shows that more than half of all students find it acceptable to use pirated books. Prison threats are not much of a deterrent but they are willing to change if prices drop significantly. 
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: High Prices Make Textbook ‘Piracy’ Acceptable to Most Students

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
Early 2020 the Bulgarian Association of Music Producers (BAMP) and IFPI launched legal action to compel local ISPs to block The Pirate Bay and Zamunda, Bulgaria's most-visited pirate site. This week a Bulgarian court ordered local ISPs to block both sites, including all mirrors and proxies. The music groups say they're pleased with the outcome but the details suggest that local ISPs were against the process right from the beginning.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Bulgarian ISPs Will Block Pirate Bay & Zamunda, But Not Before a Fight

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
Internet provider Cox Communications wants a court of appeal to reverse the $1 billion piracy liability verdict, handed down by a jury four years ago. As supplemental evidence, the ISP submitted a recent Supreme Court ruling which found Twitter not liable for aiding and abetting terrorism. The letter prompted a response from the music companies stressing that terrorism and piracy are quite different.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Music Pirates are Not Terrorists, Record Labels Argue in Court

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
Following reports of a complaint by Bell and other media companies, several searches were carried out in Canada this week as part of a TV piracy and money laundering investigation. Known locally as the Quebec Hugh Hefner, the alleged owner of a targeted IPTV service was previously sentenced in the U.S. after the DEA swapped 10kgs of cocaine found in a computer, with another white powder worth considerably less.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Controversial Pirate IPTV Supplier Investigated After Bell Complaint

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
The surprise shutdown of torrent site RARBG and its tracker came as a shock to millions of users and the knock-on effects are already being felt elsewhere in the piracy ecosystem. Other torrent sites are seeing a slowdown in fresh content, automated download apps are starting to throw up errors, and many of the largest streaming sites are missing a key source of content.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: RARBG Shutdown is a Major Blow to the Pirate Ecosystem

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
While many ISPs in Europe were initially opposed to pirate site-blocking measures, anti-censorship and free-flow of information ideals have long since given way to resignation and, in some cases, full cooperation. In the Netherlands, ISP KPN went up against BREIN recently, citing concerns over its application for a shape-shifting dynamic injunction. KPN couldn't prevent Lookmovie and Flixtor from being blocked but the discussion was one worth having.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: ISP’s Dynamic Injunction Fears Fail to Prevent Lookmovie & Flixtor Blocking

articles.author: nospam@scummvm.org (DreamMaster)
articles.description:
A stalwart party exploring the unknown, seeking the fabled Inner Sanctum. But all is not what it seems in the world of Varn...
The ScummVM Team is pleased to announce full support for the PC version of the first game of the Might and Magic series: Might and Magic Book One: The Secret of the Inner Sanctum. Two modes are supported:
The original look and feel of the game (sound, which in the original consisted of merely the occasional beep, is not supported)
A ScummVM-exclusive enhanced mode, which uses the interface of the later Xeen games, including niceties such as better character screens, automapping, and sound effects. It also integrates the impressive "Might and Magic 1 Graphics Overhaul Mod", which provides better in-game map and monster graphics. The xeen.cc file is required from Might and Magic: IV or Might and Magic: World of Xeen.
Both modes allow saving your game anywhere outside of combat via the ScummVM Global Main Menu (unlike the original game that only saved a single roster when checking into an inn). So make sure you save regularly, just in case you encounter problems.
Help us test both game modes by grabbing a daily build and adding mm.dat to the same folder as your game files. Read through our testing guidelines, and please take some screenshots along the way.
Now, go forth, and discover the true secrets of the game that started the long running epic fantasy series!
>
articles.title: Journey Now Into an Age of Chivalry in an Alternate Reality

articles.author: nospam@scummvm.org (OneEightHundred)
articles.description:
Schizm: Mysterious Journey, the second supported game of the V-Cruise engine, is ready for public testing!
Created in 2001 by Detalion and published by LK Avalon, this acclaimed 3D-rendered panoramic first-person adventure has you puzzle your way through an alien world as a team of two scientists split up when their ship crash-landed on the planet.
ScummVM currently supports the DVD and digital English releases (with subtitles in Dutch, English, French, German, Italian, Polish, Spanish, Greek, and Russian). If you’re aware of any other versions, please contact us.
To play any of these supported releases, you will need a daily development build. If you encounter any issues, please submit them to the issue tracker!
>
articles.title: There's that name again. Matia. What's going on here?

articles.description: Only a day after 13.2, we present 13.3. And there is a bit of a story here. But in short: we made a mistake with 13.2.1, and need to release a 13.3 with no functional change to make sure multiplayer games work as expected.
articles.title: OpenTTD 13.3

articles.description: As I write this many of the development team and other members of the community are busy having fun at a meet-up in Brussels. Not me though, I’m stuck here doing a release. We’ve been busy refactoring quite a lot of the underlying code to make future changes easier, but along the way we’ve found and fixed a few more bugs and quality of life improvements that we figured were worth releasing sooner than whenever 14.0 comes along. Notably, OpenTTD will now automatically disable hardware acceleration if it detects that the last crash happened while initialising the graphics driver. While hardware acceleration works well for the vast majority of people, it causes crashes for people that then required command line arguments or manual config file editing to get it to work. This should be a better solution for those users. Additionally, there is a change to the default mouse mode on Linux to improve experience when dragging the map (and often to match expected behaviour in other games). As always, there are plenty of other bugfixes, which you can find in the changelog. While you’re at it, have you seen the post about the upcoming addition of a automated opt-in survey to OpenTTD 14? If you have opinions, we’d like to hear them! Details here. PS: we made a mistake in the Windows release; a 13.2.1 was pushed to address this issue. It is fully network compatible with 13.2, so no need to update unless you want to. Download Changelog Bug tracker
articles.title: OpenTTD 13.2 (and 13.2.1)

articles.description: While working on an automated opt-in survey (about which I write in a bit), it was noticed that our privacy policy and cookie policy is rather out-of-date. Mostly, we used to store a lot more personal information when you created an account, like email addresses, passwords, etc. As we now use GitHub to handle all that, we can slim down our privacy policy, as we store very little personal information. For the cookie policy, for years now we only use cookies for the authenticated part of our websites and nothing else. OpenTTD’s privacy policy has always been: we want to know as little personal information about you as possible. And although these changes were rolled out years ago, the policies did not reflect that yet. They do now! In short: we removed statements from the policy about information we track, as we haven’t done that for years now. So, what about this automated opt-in survey you are talking about?
articles.title: Policy update and automated opt-in survey

articles.description:
Android Studio - Giraffe | 2022.3.1 Beta 5 is now available in the Beta channel.
If you already have an Android Studio build on the Beta channel, you can get the update by clicking Help > Check for Update (or Android Studio > Check for Updates on macOS). Otherwise, you can download it here.
For information on new features and changes in all preview builds of Android Studio Giraffe, see the Android Studio Preview release notes. For details of bugs fixed in each preview release, see previous entries on this blog.
General fixes and features
Here is a list of general fixes in Android Studio Giraffe Beta 5. These are a result of your bug reports, which help us to make Android Studio better. If you encounter a problem, let us know by reporting a bug. You can also vote for an existing issue to indicate that it also affects you.
articles.title: Android Studio Giraffe Beta 5 now available

articles.description:
Android Studio - Hedgehog | 2023.1.1 Canary 7 is now available in the Canary channel.
If you already have an Android Studio build on the Canary channel, you can get the update by clicking Help > Check for Update (or Android Studio > Check for Updates on macOS). Otherwise, you can download it here.
For information on new features and changes in all preview builds of Android Studio Hedgehog, see the Android Studio Preview release notes. For details of bugs fixed in each preview release, see previous entries on this blog.
General fixes and features
Here is a list of general fixes in Android Studio Hedgehog Canary 7. These are a result of your bug reports, which help us to make Android Studio better. If you encounter a problem, let us know by reporting a bug. You can also vote for an existing issue to indicate that it also affects you.
articles.title: Android Studio Hedgehog Canary 7 now available

articles.description:
Android Studio - Hedgehog | 2023.1.1 Canary 6 is now available in the Canary channel.
If you already have an Android Studio build on the Canary channel, you can get the update by clicking Help > Check for Update (or Android Studio > Check for Updates on macOS). Otherwise, you can download it here.
For information on new features and changes in all preview builds of Android Studio Hedgehog, see the Android Studio Preview release notes. For details of bugs fixed in each preview release, see previous entries on this blog.
General fixes and features
Here is a list of general fixes in Android Studio Hedgehog Canary 6. These are a result of your bug reports, which help us to make Android Studio better. If you encounter a problem, let us know by reporting a bug. You can also vote for an existing issue to indicate that it also affects you.
articles.title: Android Studio Hedgehog Canary 6 now available

articles.author: Ashley Whittaker
articles.description:
If when you think of a synth your mind automatically goes to electronic music, prepare to have your aurally-biased brain blown. This is a video synth that flips through glitchy, retro animations.
The post Vibe with the Feather RP2040 video synth appeared first on Raspberry Pi.
articles.title: Vibe with the Feather RP2040 video synth

articles.author: Ashley Whittaker
articles.description:
Richard could never remember to start the car ahead of time when it's cold outside, so he taught Raspberry Pi to do it for him
The post “Alexa, start the car”: warm up your car remotely with Raspberry Pi appeared first on Raspberry Pi.
articles.title: “Alexa, start the car”: warm up your car remotely with Raspberry Pi

articles.author: Ashley Whittaker
articles.description:
The folks at Modzy got in touch to tell us about their defect detection platform that uses Raspberry Pi and machine learning to pick up mistakes on factory production lines
The post Raspberry Pi detects factory defects with machine learning appeared first on Raspberry Pi.
articles.title: Raspberry Pi detects factory defects with machine learning

articles.author: Ashley Whittaker
articles.description:
Trainbot uses a Raspberry Pi camera to watch a piece of train track, detect trains, and stitch together images of them.
The post OnlyTrains: for fans of trains, and only trains appeared first on Raspberry Pi.
articles.title: OnlyTrains: for fans of trains, and only trains

articles.author: Rob Zwetsloot
articles.description:
The new event runner for CamJam is an old face in the community. This #MagPiMonday, we get to know him a little better. 
The post Meet Brian Corteil: CamJam event runner appeared first on Raspberry Pi.
articles.title: Meet Brian Corteil: CamJam event runner

articles.author: Ashley Whittaker
articles.description:
This giant Raspberry Pi-powered nose sculpture prints a description out of its nostril of what it has just smelled.
The post This massive nose sniffs things then prints a description of the smell appeared first on Raspberry Pi.
articles.title: This massive nose sniffs things then prints a description of the smell

articles.author: Ashley Whittaker
articles.description:
Paragraphica is a camera that creates AI-generated "photos" using your location data. We spotted this on Twitter yesterday, loved it, saw it explode, then were delighted to learn it's powered by Raspberry Pi.
The post Paragraphica creates “photos” based on your location appeared first on Raspberry Pi.
articles.title: Paragraphica creates “photos” based on your location

articles.author: Ashley Whittaker
articles.description:
Seery Chen, a student at the University of Toronto, got in touch about their Raspberry Pi-powered PhD thesis project: a telescope called the Dragonfly Spectral Line Mapper. 
The post Dragonfly Spectral Line Mapper appeared first on Raspberry Pi.
articles.title: Dragonfly Spectral Line Mapper

articles.author: Rosie Hattersley
articles.description:
A tech fan’s plan to give something back to his community led to a Raspberry Pi-based dispenser.
The post Refurbished vending machine appeared first on Raspberry Pi.
articles.title: Refurbished vending machine

articles.author: Ben Everard
articles.description:
Oscilloscopes are, at heart, very simple tools. They take a voltage and use that to display a point on a screen, usually, in a time-based graph. That’s really all it takes to be an oscilloscope. However, underneath this is a huge web of complexity.
The post DSO-500K oscilloscope | HackSpace #67 appeared first on Raspberry Pi.
articles.title: DSO-500K oscilloscope | HackSpace #67
